meanings.definition: To come into violent contact; crash
meanings.sent1: The cars were colliding on the road.
meanings.sent2: The two players collided during the game.
meanings.sent3: The colliding sounds of the crashing waves were soothing.
meanings.sent4: Ideas and opinions were colliding in the heated debate.
meanings.sent5: The image of the colliding asteroids was breathtaking.

meanings.sent1: Their schedules are colliding, causing a problem.
meanings.sent2: The two teams are colliding in the final match.
meanings.sent3: Their colliding interests led to a humorous misunderstanding.
meanings.sent4: The colliding personalities in the group created tension.
meanings.sent5: The colliding colors in the painting created a vibrant effect.

meanings.sent1: Her beliefs were colliding with his, causing a debate.
meanings.sent2: The two political parties are colliding on this issue.
meanings.sent3: Their colliding viewpoints made for an interesting discussion.
meanings.sent4: The colliding forces of good and evil were at play.
meanings.sent5: The colliding ideologies shaped the course of history.
